title: Functional contextualism-based science learning design

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic science theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Corporate-affiliated science education program structured around real-world job-linked case studies.

learning_goals: They can explain scientific phenomena in situational contexts by applying Relational Frame Theory (RFT) principles.
From a functional contextualist perspective, they can interpret experimental data and propose practical solutions.
Through collaborative problem-solving with peers, they construct relational frames for complex scientific problems.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
